user_request: Write three rhyming couplets about a journey home.
final_poem:
The highway stretches like a thread
between the city and my mother's pray'r,
and under every mile I sweat it, shed—
the years between us, thin as paper now.

I press my thumb against the steering wheel
where she'd rest her hand if seated there,
though miles wide divide us, though the deal
of distance keeps us each inside our air.

The dashboard light turns everything to blue.
My phone holds up its small blue screen,
and somewhere past the exits, you—
my mother, in the house, doing nothing but waiting.
